titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1599b
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1599b

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

Text preserved in this squeeze:
1.m of the lineage of Madihum, servant of Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin 2.[di]rected and completed all of the digging and levelling and paving of 3.the construction and renovation of the temple of Waddum and ʾAthīrat 4.in Qalay-by the command of his lord, Yadaʿʾab.
Restored full text of the inscription:
1.[ʾAwsʿamm bin Yiṣūrʿa]mm of the lineage of Madihum, servant of Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin 2.[Shahr, king of Qatabān, has di]rected and completed all of the digging and levelling and paving of 3.[the mountain pass of Mablaqat and al]l of the construction and renovation of the temple of Waddum and ʾAthīrat 4.[and the residence of the king] in Qalay-by the command of his lord, Yadaʿʾab.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
m of the lineage of Madihum, servant of Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin
directed and completed all of the digging and levelling and paving of
the construction and renovation of the temple of Waddum and ʾAthīrat
in Qalay-by the command of his lord, Yadaʿʾab.
Restored full text of the inscription:
ʾAwsʿamm bin Yiṣūrʿamm of the lineage of Madihum, servant of Yadaʿʾab Dhubyān bin
Shahr, king of Qatabān, has directed and completed all of the digging and levelling and paving of
the mountain pass of Mablaqat and all of the construction and renovation of the temple of Waddum and ʾAthīrat
and the residence of the king in Qalay-by the command of his lord, Yadaʿʾab.

Text preserved in this squeeze:
